page.title: 03HOUSING - AUCHINLECK
page.content: The majority of houses in Auchinleck are owned by the council and rented to the tenant. The older houses were built to replace the traditional miners' rows in 1927 and the two later phases of building (1938,1947-55) were to meet the demand for housing when families moved into the area as the coal mining operations expanded.They are mainly 3/4 apartments,2 storey buildings with full services of water and electricity and or gas. Owner occupier houses form a ribbon development along the main roads.These houses are mainly detached / semi-detached bungalows. The older houses are built mainly of sandstone which came from a local quarry. There is a Sheltered Housing complex for the elderly adjoining the old folks home ,Affleck House.
